title: Edit a Service Level Target set record
content:
You can edit a Service Level Target set record that describes the type of target and associated Service Management module.

You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right. For more information, see Mass update.

To edit a Service Level Target set:

  1. From the main menu, select Plan > Service Level > Service Level Target Sets.

  2. Select the record you want to edit.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

  3. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

  4. Edit the form with new information in the General tab.
    Edit the Details and Definition defaults sections. For a description of each field in these sections, see Create a Service Level Target set record.

    Notes

    • After you save the changes to Target Types, the Service Level Target definitions section is updated accordingly. When an SLT is already running for a record, if you try to append/remove a target type to the target set, the change won't take effect.

    • If you change the default setting for Work Schedule or Time zone, Service Management applies the change to all Service Level Target definitions of the Service Level Target set where these fields are blank.

    • The work schedule restricts the time of the target definition. For example, if the target definition duration is 3 days and the work schedule is 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM (9 hours per day), the target is only breached after 8 work days (72 hours).
    • The Favorite feature is supported only in Studio's M2M grids. For example, the 'Service level targets' table is a custom grid rather than an M2M grid in Studio, therefore, the Favorite feature can't be used with the 'Service level targets' table.

    Edit the Service Level Target definitions section. This section displays the target definitions associated with this Service Level Target set. For each target definition, the grid displays the target name, target type, priority, and duration.

    Field Description
    Details Click this icon to edit the selected target definition. Available only when only one target definition is selected. For details, see Edit a Service Level Target definition record.
    Refresh Refreshes the target definition grid.
    Switch priority grouping
    Note This switch is only available if your module has a Priority attribute.

    Toggles between grouped and ungrouped targets.

    For each target type, you can group all the priorities into a single target, or split them into four separate targets. When you split one target into four, the target duration value is copied to all of the new targets. When you choose to group all priorities, the system deletes the old target definitions and creates a new one with default settings.   

  5. Select the Rules tab to edit the business rules for the Service Level Target set. 
    This tab is available only when a custom record type is selected as Target Sets Module. For more information about the business rules, see Offering business rules and How to add Service Level Target event business rules

  6. Click   Save on the toolbar.
  7. When you make changes to Target Types or Target Definitions, the changes require an update to every record using these targets. The changes will take effect automatically within 24 hours. Alternatively, you can click Apply now at the top of the Service Level Management page to trigger the update immediately. The amount of time to complete the update depends on the number of affected records. If one of those records is open, click Refresh to see the updates. If you make additional changes to a Target Type or a Target Definition after applying the changes manually, the Apply now button will reappear after 5 minutes.

You can click the History tab to view changes to the selected record. For more information, see History.
